actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Government Operations.
Referred to Subcommittee on Legislation and National Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Legislation and National Security

official_title: A bill to provide for the regular review of certain Federal Agencies and for the abolition of such agencies after such review unless Congress specifically provides for their continued existence.
short_title: Federal Agency Control and Review Act

summary.text: Federal Agency Control and Review Act - Requires the Office of Management and Budget to study the structure, efficiency, and effectiveness of each Executive agency every ten years and to report to the President and Congress any recommendations for the reorganization or abolition of any agency. Abolishes each agency upon the due date of such report unless, during the ten-year period since the last report, legislation to continue such agency has been enacted.

titles.title: Federal Agency Control and Review Act
A bill to provide for the regular review of certain Federal Agencies and for the abolition of such agencies after such review unless Congress specifically provides for their continued existence.
